private_information: Expert in formalizing operator schemas (preconditions and effects).
Captures lifted predicates and action signatures from natural language.
Keeps action names and argument orders stable across all instances.
modeler.goal: Derive clean, lifted operator schemas and predicate vocabulary from the action descriptions without emitting PDDL.

private_information: Extracts instances, initial states, goals, and any provided plan sketches.
Normalizes object constants and ensures consistent naming across scenarios.
Does not change the semantics of the human specification.
state_curator.goal: Encode all scenarios with objects, initial facts, goals, and optional plan sketches in a structured, consistent format.

private_information: Audits temporal and causal soundness across plans and schemas.
Disallows bookkeeping shortcuts such as implicit tokens, hidden resources, or post-hoc penalties.
Flags and resolves mismatches between lifted schemas and grounded instances.
consistency_auditor.goal: Check that preconditions enable actions, effects update state correctly, and that action schemas, objects, and plans remain causally consistent.

private_information: Integrates schemas, instances, and audit findings into one planning model.
Generates the final PDDL domain and one problem per scenario, targeting the FastDownward solver.
Keeps predicate and action names consistent and uses STRIPS with effects as add/delete lists.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a coherent PDDL domain and problem set suitable for FastDownward, reflecting all actions and scenarios after audit.

public_information: Domain vocabulary (predicates are unary or binary as written): hand x; cats x; sneeze x; spring x; stupendous x; texture x; next x y; vase x y; collect x y.
Actions and schemas (lifted, ordered arguments as shown):
paltry(o0, o1, o2): pre = {hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2}; add = {next o0 o2}; del = {vase o0 o1}.
sip(o0, o1, o2): pre = {hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2}; add = {vase o0 o1}; del = {next o0 o2}.
clip(o0, o1, o2): pre = {hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2}; add = {vase o0 o1}; del = {next o0 o2}.
wretched(o0, o1, o2, o3): pre = {sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3}; add = {next o0 o2}; del = {next o0 o1}.
memory(o0, o1, o2): pre = {cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1}; add = {next o0 o2}; del = {next o0 o1}.
tightfisted(o0, o1, o2): pre = {hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1}; add = {next o0 o2}; del = {vase o0 o1}.
All actions are STRIPS-style with add and delete effects only; types are implicit and derived from predicate usage.
Scenarios define concrete objects and ground facts; orchestrator will compile a domain and one problem per scenario for FastDownward.

parse_actions.system_prompt: You extract lifted operator schemas (names, parameters, preconditions, add and delete effects) and the predicate signature from public information. You do not produce PDDL.
parse_actions.prompt: Your name is modeler. Read the shared action descriptions and produce a consistent, machine-readable schema for actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted with ordered parameters and explicit preconditions/effects.

encode_instances.system_prompt: You ground objects, initial states, goals, and incorporate any user-supplied plan sketches per scenario. You do not produce PDDL.
encode_instances.prompt: Your name is state_curator. Using the environment instances, compile for each scenario the object list, initial_facts, goal_facts, and proposed_plan exactly as given, preserving naming consistency.

audit_plan.system_prompt: You audit causal preconditions and effects across proposed plans and instances, highlight any unsatisfied preconditions or undefined symbols, and recommend minimal corrections without introducing artificial bookkeeping shortcuts.
audit_plan.prompt: Your name is consistency_auditor. Verify that each proposed plan step is applicable under the evolving state given the schemas; report any violations and provide corrected notes while keeping actions and predicates unchanged.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-scenario PDDL modeling targeting the FastDownward solver. Produce one PDDL domain capturing all actions and predicates and one PDDL problem per scenario. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and each problem between <problem></problem>. Keep action names and predicates exactly as specified, use STRIPS, include :strips and :equality only if needed, and ensure problems enumerate :objects, :init, and :goal.
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Integrate the action schemas, the scenarios, and the audit findings. Generate a single coherent domain and separate problem files for each scenario in the instances bundle, ready for FastDownward.
